title: janthinaa.github.io
text:
About
hi ! I’m Janthina. In my project, I have chosen to explore the trends in Olympic Swimming.

Data
Link to the data set that I have chosen: https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/datasciencedonut/olympic-swimming-1912-to-2020
Since the athletes are categorized by ‘Team’ using the country codes assigned by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) instead of their country’s names, we can use the following data set to assign them:
https://github.com/johnashu/datacamp/blob/master/medals/Summer%20Olympic%20medalists%201896%20to%202008%20-%20IOC%20COUNTRY%20CODES.csv
{r}
#| out.width: "80%"
#| label: fig-airquality
#| fig-cap: Temperature and ozone level.
#| warning: false
#| eval: FALSE
library(tidyverse)
ggplot(airquality, aes(Temp, Ozone)) +
geom_point() +
geom_smooth(method = "loess")

title: Challenge 9
text:

walt_disney_movies <-read.csv("/Users/janthinatan/Desktop/NM2207/Week 9 /walt_disney_movies.csv")

glimpse(walt_disney_movies)

#Clean data 

library(lubridate)
walt_disney_movies <- na.omit(walt_disney_movies)

#Convert Release.date to Date format
walt_disney_movies$Release.date <- as.Date(walt_disney_movies$Release.date)

#Summarize average box office sales by year
box_office_summary <- walt_disney_movies %>%
  group_by(Year = year(Release.date)) %>%
  summarise(Avg_Box_Office = mean(Box.office, na.rm = TRUE))
  
box_office_summary

# A tibble: 67 × 2
